newsitem.title: USA: CD Radio shares off on panel decision.
newsitem.headline: CD Radio shares off on panel decision.

text.p: Shares in CD Radio Inc fell nearly 50 percent after an independent panel rejected the company's application for a so-called pioneer's preferencing for its satellite digital audio radio service.
A CD Radio spokesman said the company had not yet received a copy of the panel's decision but confirmed the panel had decided against the preferencing.

Such a preference would have reserved CD Radio a license in the event the U.S. Federal Communications Commission had auctioned off airwaves for use in the service, which is intended to provide satellite-based radio communications to motorists primarily in rural markets.
